result.execSummary:
The defendant Arron Mark Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or at any time defendant does not hold that status defendant must complete 10 hours community service per week.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
May transfer probation to Winnebago Co.
1 day credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arron Mark Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

dft
Plea hearing 9/17/15
Moved, left no address; unable to forward
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:50am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person and with Atty Robin Kennedy  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:Ct. 2 (DC)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 6 months Probation
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; N/C w/victim R.T.; FTE/FT schooling or cominbation thereof, or at any time defendant does not hold that status, must complete 10 hours community service/week; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.
  COURT advises defendant of possible right to expungement of DNA SAMPLE only under certain statutory authority.

>>IF revoked, credit for one day of time served
>>Probation may be TRANSFERRED to Winnebago County.

Adj: 8:57am

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:59pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant does NOT appear - Attorney Robin Kennedy appears on his behalf
(Originally set for plea at 1:45pm)

Atty Kennedy states she has had no contact with her client but agreement reached

COURT directs parties to reset plea for hearing next week.
Bond continues

Adj: 2:01pm

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 10:28am
State appears by ADA C.Minder. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Robin Kennedy.

Atty Kennedy states defendant's name is misspelled moves to AMEND spelling of defendant on criminal complaint -- correct spelling of first name is ARRON - COURT grants.
 
Parties note agreement has NOT been reached in this matter.
COURT questions parties as to discovery and if any motions will be filed before trial; Atty Kennedy is requesting further photos for discovery and prior convictions motion may be needed per State

COURT leaves FPT/JT dates on court's calendar
COURT questions parties if there is any reason this case cannot go forward as scheduled for trial - both parties agree it may go forward as scheduled.
Bond continues.

Adj: 10:30am

No contact with victim(s):  R.T.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
